Poured 11.2 oz bottle into snifter glass. 5.4% abv  Appearance- Pours a glowing honey yellow with high white head that hangs around the glass before receding.  Smell- Yeast, banana, clove  Taste- Fresh wheat base grain taste with hints of lemon. Picks up a bit midway into a more floral sweetness with a banana bread flavor. The banana notes hang around and rounds off the flavor profile with a clove/black pepper spice note.  Mouthfeel- Medium in body with active carbonation.  Overall- One outstanding hefeweizen to be had here. So smooth with a refreshing feel. The banana bread flavor really shines through in this one which is a showing of a fine hefeweizen. This one is as best as any for the style.

This definitely has all the amazing reviews for a reason. Had this on draft at Au Cheval Chicago. This wheat beer is full those wheat banana flavors that you wish every Hefe Weiss had! It's a tremendous beer and everyone should try it. No questions just tip this bad boy back.
L: Hazy amber/golden color, four finger white head, ok lacing, good carbonation.  S: Banana, malts.  T: Banana, malts.  F: Light bodied, refreshing.  O: Good weissbier.

Just an absolute classic. Golden/burnt orange colored beer, lightly hazy. Tons of beautiful head. The aroma and flavor are loaded with banana, clove, and peppery spice, some bubblegum hints as well. The malts are also very dough like and slightly toasty, like bread. The beer has a super rich, ful, mouthfeel yet is smooth and easy drinkable.
Smells like a bud

Pours a hazy golden color with a thick, one inc white head that is well retained. Smells of banana spices (especially cloves), and yeast. Taste follows the nose with additions of bread and pepper. Incredibly well balanced and drinkable, smooth mouthfeel . An amazing hefeweizen.

Pours a hazy dark straw color with a thick, fluffy white head. Aroma is banana, clove, bread dough. Taste follows with wonderful notes of banana and bready malt flavor, yeasty flavors all around, and only a hint of cloves. Smooth and refreshing Mouthfeel. Overall, this is an excellent hefeweizen and definitely one of the best in style from a brewery with amazing history.

Pours a hazy blonde color with a generous head and lacing Aroma has clove, banana, wheat and various spices hints The taste follows the nose with clove, banana, wheat and various spices flavor A medium bodied well carbonated beer A very well done wheat beer

Poured bottle into Weizen glass. It has a golden-yellow couldy color, with 2.5 finger white foam head and some lacing. Aroma of yeast, cloves and a sweet bread along with some banana. The flavor is right on with the nose. It is full bodied and smooth with a nice refreshing, clean finish. Awesome Hefe!
Not my style at all but best hefe I've had

This is what a Hefeweizen should look, taste, smell and feel like. This is the epitome of a perfect beer. The quintessential beer made following strictly the German purity law of 1516. If you have not tried this before... You are missing on one of the the bests beers in the world. Period!

Weihenstephaner, the king of Hefeweizen, this is truly the benchmark for the style; it's all cloves, banana bread, cream, yeast, and spices; so big, smooth and drinkable. It's excellent to think that a brewery operating for so long is still putting out the best after all this time.
Simply put, the best wheat beer in the world. There are many others that have tried to emulate what Weihenstephaner has done but none can match it.

I have been on a kick for Hef's since I had Funky Buddha's down in Florida. Had this years ago before the IPA craze and went back to it and it is out of this world delicious. So glad I revisited. Smooth, tart nose and nice banana apple taste with a dry finish. Will have this beer much more in the future. Ice cold makes it even better.

On tap, pours a cloudy orange, like a light-colored apple cider. Smell is fruity and a little spicy, with definite clove and banana notes. Taste is classic wheat beer, with some tartness that offsets the fruitiness. Nice bready, yeasty finish. Not my favorite style, but I appreciate the quality.

Not much to say that hasn't already been said in someone else's review. I really got a strong pepper-y clove smell in it, but it was nice. Flavor is outstanding for a Hefeweizen - just so smooth and drinkable and the wheat flavor is really crisp.  What I found really cool is that this is a beer thats been brewed at a brewery operating since the 11th century and its amazing.

Light gold in color and very hazy. There's a solid inch of densely packed brilliant white foam on top. Heavy lacing. Aroma is comprised of faint banana esters and pale wheat. I taste very light pale wheat and faint banana esters. The mouth is very delicate, light, and faintly creamy.
Clove Refreshing fantastic beer

Probably the most perfect hefeweizen there is and certainly the best I've had. Pours a hazy golden orange, looks beautiful held up to the light. Big, fluffy, off white head. Smells like the usual banana and cloves, with a hint of citrus. Taste is more or less the same, rich and full flavored but not overwhelmingly sweet or spicy like some hefes I've had. Just very well balanced. Feel is exceptional. I was amazed at how smooth and creamy this beer is while still maintaining great carbonation. Lingering, pleasant aftertaste on the finish. This beer is legendary for a reason!

Pours a murky straw color with half a finger fluffy white head. Nose is banana bread and cloves. Taste is similar: banana bread, cloves, pecans, subtle citrus. Nice long finish. Medium carb. Feel is slightly crisp. Overall, an excellent hefe. It absolutely lives up its reputation as the gold standard of the style.

One pint .9 fl oz, coded 2365, poured into a Weihenstephaner hefe glass.  A - Cloudy golden orange/yellow with three fingers of fluffy white head that retains for a while.  S - Banana bread, yeast, clove/spices.  T - Right in line with nose, with some back end biscuit/cereal grains and lemon notes. As it warms, the yeast and spice move more to the forefront.  M.- Carbonation is a touch above medium. Feel seems both creamy and crisp.  O - Pretty tasty, if a little aged. Extremely well made, and holds up as the model for the style.

Poured into a Weihenstephaner Hefe glass.  Appearance: A beautiful golden amber, cloudy. Absolute belter of a head; rocky, fluffy and dense. Retains it all the way down the glass. Lacing is sticky and ubiquitous.  Smell: Fresh bread is there, as is banana and a mild clove. Hints of citrus fruit in there too.  Taste: Wow! So good, almost like drinking banana bread, not overpowering or too rich though, and there is plenty of chalky, dry yeast flavour to calm it.  Mouth-feel: Medium body, excellent carbonation and very easy to drink.  Overall: It's been said many times before and with good reason. This is one of the very best Hefes and an easily drinkable beer for the style. I could easily polish off 4 or 5 of these in one sitting. Simply a stunning beer and thoroughly recommended, even if you aren't a fan of the style.
A taste that you could actually recall despite trying other types of beer. Then once in a while, you'd recall the smell and taste of it. Next thing you know, you are at checkout paying for a sixer.

LOOKS: Hazy dark golden with 3+ fingers of creamy off white head. It sticks around for a while and leaves a pretty nice lacing down the glass. Loads of carbonation streaming up the glass. AROMA: Fresh cut grass, loads of banana bread, & cloves. That is what you expect, that is what you get. TASTE: Just like aroma, great bready quality. FEEL: Ultra smooth. Absolutely nothing harsh about this beer. Soft on the palate. Perfect level of carbonation, not overkill. Dries up nicely on finish, a little slick up front. OVERALL: I just haven't had a smoother, more flavorful Hefe than this. It tastes very natural, like nothing is being forced to bring this beer together.

Probably my favorite beer or at least in the top 3. This is exactly what I want in a hefe. Its refreshing, crisp, and quenches your thirst. The brewery is the oldest in the world- for good reason. This beer is the definition of a hefe.

Perfect 10/10. This is not "an" example of Hefe Weißbier, it is THE example. Complex, infinitely refreshing, historically accurate and simply marvelous in every way. An absolute must have for any beer enthusiast, esepecially Bavarian varietals.
first beer i had that made me think: "wow beer can be for taste not just to get drunk" taste is subtle but it lingers in the back of my throat for like 18 hours

Look: Poured into a hefeweizen glass, this beer has a beautiful fluffy white head that remains until your last sip. It has a wonderful straw gold color near the head that fades into a more vibrant yellow near the bottom of the glass.  Smell: I got a lemon-y smell mixed with a fruit that I couldn't immediately identify. Some notes of bread. (I'll be honest, my sense of smell isn't very developed yet)  Taste: Excellent. I was finally able to identify where the smell of the beer was coming from: bananas. It had the taste of bananas mixed with sort of an upfront lemon flavor. The aftertaste leaves that banana flavor on your tongue with just a touch of bitterness, enough to let you know that your just drank a beer. I gave this to a friend of mine who isn't really into beer to try and this is the only thing he's had so far that he likes. Extra props for that.  Feel: It feels really smooth to drink, with I'd say a medium amount of carbonation. You're going to be burping a bit from drinking this beer. You get a medium-light mouth-feel from it and there's just this great refreshing coolness to it.  Overall: Just a great beer, first I've had of the style. Really makes me want to go out and try more hefeweizens! Very deserving of a world-class ranking.
This beer defines it's style. Delicious, affordable, and available. World class beer, from the world's oldest brewer. If you haven't tried it, you should not post another review until you do.

Poured from a bottle into a hefeweizen glass. Appearance: Golden yellow with hue of orange. Head is mild in size and white. Smell: Very pleasant mixture of banana and citrus. Taste: The classic clean hefeweissbier flavor plus a perfect mixture of citrus and banana. There is a very mildly bitter, but pleasant, aftertaste. Absolutely sublime. Mouthfeel: Strong carbonation, yet this beer goes down very easily. Overall. Quite simply, this is a superb beer. Anyone who is a fan of the hefeweiss style needs to try this beer.

smell is very sweet lots of banana. Taste banana nutmeg bubblegum a fruity sweetness breadiness lemon in the aftertaste Overall: it's an awesome beer that you need to try if you like this style probably the best beer in this style.

I had this on draft 1/29/16 at the Maybank Public House on James Island, and enjoyed it very much. It was served in the traditional tall hefe style glass, and had a nice cloudy creamy look to it. The smell was somewhat fruity with banana and a little clove. Taste was great, and spot on for its style. If you like hefe's, you cant go wrong with this.

I am glad to see some lighter beers on the Top Beers list. This is a world class hefe from the world's oldest brewery that was established almost a millenium ago in 1040. I had a glass on 1/29/16. Very crisp and clean with some clove notes at the finish. Absolutely fantastic.

500ml bottle bought for $5.90 poured into a pint glass  Look: Cloudy golden straw, large amount of carbonation visible, initial three finger head dissipates into strong lacing.  Smell: Initial sweetness with hint of banana like herb, slightly yeasty.  Taste: Almost exactly the same as the smell, bubblegum sweetness with herb-y, banana/clove.  Feel: Silken, medium thickness, extremely carbonated.  Overall: Great beer, not one for a solid drinking sesh, but perfect for one beer after work, or relaxing on the weekend.
The Hefe by which all others should be judged. Excellent on tap. I usually drink IPA - but break my style selection for this authentic German wheat beer that tastes like nothing else. Love it.
L: Orange gold in a big glass! S: Citrus, slight hops, some earthy malt sweetness T: Bubble gum, clove, nutmeg, banana-esq, apple F: Thick and fluffy O: Liquid gold

Let me just start this review by saying that I have had Weihenstephaner many times before, and that it is one of my all time favourite beers, and my all time favourite Hefeweizen. Weihenstephaner is the beer that introduced me to a world beyond macros.  Appearance: One of the most appetizing beers I've ever seen. A pale, orange/gold like colour with about two and a half fingers of extremely creamy head. The beer is extremely cloudy, as sediment blocks almost all light from getting through. Gorgeous lacing on the glass.  Smell: I can't get over how clean and refreshing this beer smells. Absolutely incredible, and easily in the top five beers I've had in regards to the aroma. A floral like aroma filled with banana bread and spices. Pepper is also present. You have to smell this beer for yourself to get a full appreciation of how good it is.  Taste: Absolutely world class. I anxiously await the time that I find a hefe better than this one. Bananas on the forefront with cloves, pepper and bubble gum. A sweet, bready taste is also prominent on the back end.  feel: Again, world class. Medium mouth feel with an almost tangy medium carbonation. Despite the medium body, extremely refreshing.  I can't stop raving about this beer. Whenever I have a friend that wants to try something a little better than Miller or Coors, I pick up a couple of these. One of the tastiest, easiest drinking beers I have ever had the pleasure of drinking. I can not recommend this beer enough if you haven't had it.

If there is a better Weißbier out of the bottle I have yet to meet it. I bet this is great on tap too. Only thing I will add to last few reviews is that the feel of this beer reminds me of a nice soft pillow of creamy wheat. By no means a dessert beer, just the best mouth feel I have ever experienced. Can see why this is held in such regard. I am glad I woke up and have started to give these Bavarian Weißbiers the attention they deserve.

Look - Cloudy/hazy pale to light golden color. Beautiful fluffy white head Smell - Clove, spice, fruity/banana notes, bubblegum Taste - Follows the nose. Fruity, banana, wheat, clove, spice, lemony type citrus, fresh bread  Overall - Above and far beyond any hefeweizen I've had or probably ever will have. Such a treat. Goes down as smooth as can be.

This is a beer that came out of nowhere and impressed me. It was actually the replacement for another wheaty beer I wanted to try (leffe blonde ale), so I wasnt expecting much. The bar tender seemed disapointed to tell me this all they had when I asked for lighter wheat beer. "Bananas, cloves" he warned. I dove right in with a pint after only a taste. Wow. So impressed. It was exactly that. Had that signature Belgium sweet with surprising banana/fruit aftertaste. The look is average. Golden yellow could with some fizz. Stays fizzed for a while though. Feels smooth and mellow going down (what I love). The smell is not powerful. Its really quite unassuming until you get your nose up in there. I would reccomend this beer to anyone who is really involved in the taste. It cant be beat as far as im concerned. Sweet, smooth, fruity, drinkable. Love it.

Had this one half from the glass, half from the bottle. Quintessentially hefe. The aromas of clove and banana bread linger in the nostrils as the flavor of bubblegum joins in on the palate. The gorgeously hazy glow shimmers through even the plainest of glasses, which I was using. More that just worth a try.

Poured from a 0.5 L bottle into a Weihenstephaner wheat beer glass. Bottled on code is 0335 (10th Aug 2015 if I decoded correctly).  Look -- A gentle pour gives three fingers of creamy white head sitting atop a hazy pale gold body. Minimal lacing as the head just slides right back down the glass as you sip.  Smell -- Clove, banana, and bubblegum atop bready wheat notes. Yeast and apricot notes are also present in the background.  Taste -- Taste like it smells.  Feel -- Lively carbonation combine with a thick body to create a creamy mouthfeel.  Overall -- You'll be hard pressed to find a better hefeweizen.
notes from Sept 2011 - "pretty good" - I'd drink this all day. Nice color. I love these style beers, so I'm easily impressed. Had at the Bronx Ale House.
One of Kat's favorite Hefeweizen beers, if not her favorite.

500ml bottle poured into Sam Adams perfect pint glass.  Looks beautiful. Pours a hazy, late summer afternoon golden yellow with three fingers of whipped eggwhite head that leaves a solid foothill landscape of lace as it recedes.  Smells of clove, banana chips, faint bubblegum and lemon zest.  Tastes of white bread, more clove and dry banana, lemonade, light crisp apple and faint white pepper.  Feels lovely. Body is medium-light with fuzzy, relaxing carbonation. Finishes clean, dry and refreshing.  Verdict: Vigorously recommended. Believe everything you've heard.

Pours in orange color with about 1 finger of frothy white head. Aromas of banana, bubblegum, clove, cinnamon, yeast. Taste is similar with banana, clove, and a very yeasty finish. Mouthfeel is light, very carbonated, and refreshing.  A classic German Hefe that is true to style.

My fridge is stuffed with all manner of IPAs, stouts, porters, pale ales, barrel aged offerings and the rest...but this is the only hefeweizen you'll find in there. The best. World class. Delicious, beautiful, clean, crisp and easy to drink. It's a damn near perfect style representation - banana, cloves, nut, malt, wheat, apricot and some peach. Surprisingly affordable and available. Lucky for us!

Wondering if I got an old bottle, good beer but not great. I was expecting great. Poured into a pint, cloudy yellow color with thin head and light lacing. Smell was subdued but floral. Taste was again more subdued than expected, faintly of cloves and banana. I will need to try it again, but buy a bottle at another store.  Had another bottle. Much better!  Had yet another - love this beer!

A-This beer has a nice hazy golden color. The head is about 2 inches at pour and settles at about half an inch. Decent head retention with minimal lacing. This is a great looking beer and filled out my weizen glass perfectly!  S-Smell is very yeasty with hints of citrus and orange peel.  T-Perfect example of what hefeweizen beer should be. Balanced with a solid citrus note and mild sweetness. Great spice flavor on the back end with a barely noticeable bitterness. The finish is refreshing and clean. I love the lingering spices on the palate.  M-Lots of carbonation in a good way with a medium body. Easy to drink beer.  O-I am a big fan of hefeweizen beers. For my money it doesn't get much better than this one. Definitely my go-to on a hot summer day or when I just want a beer without thinking too much about it.

Look: Hazy and unfiltered, gold to amber. Poured a thick head, around one inch. Head dissipates quickly, and left little to no lacing.  Smell: Banana and clove, spice and yeast. Everything you'd expect; and I mean that in the best way. If you're drinking this, you most likely have a good idea of what you're in for and it doesn't disappoint.  Taste: Imagine liquefied banana bread with notes of cinnamon and nutmeg. Unmistakable Hefe flavors. Pleasant aftertaste that satisfies between tastes.  Feel: Fairly carbonated, medium to light mouthfeel. Deceiving amount of creaminess capable of coating the mouth that lingers well beyond the initial impression.  Overall: Very drinkable, and at 5.40% it can go the distance. A worthy standard by which other beers of its nature should be compared.

L: hazy gold color ,clearly unfiltered ,give a big top of foam when i pour it in the glass. S: Yeast,flowers,banana,spices . A very sweet smell T:Very smooth and fruity flavour, very similar to the smell F: Carbonation is high, the beer is full of flavours and very creamy.and so refreshing. This is a delicioius Hefeweiss O: This is a delicious beer, this beer gives all it promises in the look and smell when you taste it. a world class beer.

I love wheat beers and this is a gem.  Cloudy, golden, yellow colour with huge, dense head that recedes slowly to a 1mm white cap. Some lacing.  The nose is quite subtle. Plenty of spice and citrus but not overwhelming.  Tons of wheat, yeast, clove & citrus but perfectly balanced and eminently drinkable. So smooth. So refreshing.  Sensational, smooth mouthfeel. Coats the tongue. Slight prickle.  A fabulous beer. Excellent in the summer served straight from the fridge and, served a tad warmer, it also makes for a big, spicy hit on a wet, dark day in January.

One standout Hefeweizen. Aroma of spicy citrus and grain. Taste of coriander, lemon curd, orange peel and grain. Creamy finish with lemon spIciness shining through. Refreshing. Great with food. Had this on tap. Mind blown!

Pours a hazy golden color. Has an aroma of Belgian yeast and something that reminds me of coriander. Flavor is a little Belgian yeast / over ripe banana. Leaves a clean smooth aftertaste. Overall very solid.

A long lasting pillow of white foam over a hazy straw color Yeast grain smell not that strong Fruity with a very light hint of malt Unctuous mouthful almost chewy and more than I'd ever noticed in any light beer , wheat or otherwise This is an exceptional beer, best in style

L: bright orange with white head S: German yeast and bananas. Light and fruity T: just like the smell, but I want to add that it's full of flavor F: tingly feel, almost like soda. Thin, but flavors hang around a long nicely. O: really good sessionable beer that's full flavored

A: Cloudy, golden with a very thick,white cloud-like head of 3~4 fingers thickness. There are no bubbles to be seen. The foam stays for a really long time, which makes it very inviting, even after drinking half of it.  S: Yeasty smell, bread, and clove. Very gentle and pleasant. Some floral or honey notes. Also, some banana.  T: The taste follows the smell. Very yeasty, bread, clove and banana. Nice and refreshing, There is a bit of bitterness which complements the rest of the flavours perfectly. There is a lot of stuff there, but in a very gentle way. Superb material!  F: High carbonation, creamy and very gentle. Full of flavours, this beer is absolutely fantastic.  O: Really refreshing, gentle, creamy, and full of aromas and flavours. Definitely, the best wheat beer I have tried. Each of the tasting notes are well defined, and makes this beer really pleasant to drink. I will buy it again.
Everything you want from a Hefe. Banana on the nose, big fluffy white head, lingering wheat finish. Absolutely perfect Hefe!

This is one of the best hefeweissbier's that I've ever had. It's incredibly good. It's smooth, rich, and aromatic, coupled with a traditional wheat beer taste that leaves you craving more. I didn't couple it with a meal - just slowly enjoyed a bottle (no glasses available - I'd love to try it again in a glass). I can't speak highly enough for this one. Get one and enjoy it.
Just an incredible beer!
Tastes like what beer should taste like. Think beerfest

bottle poured into a weizen glass.  L -hazey bright yellow  S - mild yeast and citrus. Actually smells a little like banana nut muffin.  T - Sweet bread, with a nice clean finish. Smooth and fisnishes quick.  F - Almost velvety for a hefeweizens.  O - This is the best hefeweizen I have ever had. I was at a liquor store and I saw the Alstom Bros rated it 100 so I had to try it. I can honestly say I didn't know hefeweizens could be this good.
The Ultimate Hefe-Weisen!  Banana smell: clean, crisp: Refreshing.  The Germans know what their doing.

Reviewed 7/15/12  L: Hazy slightly dark straw color with a big billowy head and excellent head retention.  S: Delicious sweet-smelling aroma that’s chock full of banana and clove. Distinctively weiss-bier and well done.  T: Semi-sweet taste upfront that’s heavy on the bananas and a semi-sweet finish that leaves a very pleasant taste in the mouth. Classic hefe; it doesn't get much better than this.  F: Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, and abundant carbonation that simply add to this beer’s drinkability.  O: I can't speak highly enough about this beer. If I had to choose 10 beers to drink till the end of my days this would be among them and I'm hard-pressed to think of a better summer beer. It's completely emblematic of the style and captures all of a hefe's best qualities.
Great light wheat beer. Some banana but it is not too over the top. A pleasant easy drinking hefe.

A 500ml bottle with a best before date of 3rd June 2016 and poured into a Riedel weizen glass.  Appearance: It poured a cloudy golden straw yellow colour with a fluffy and puffy three finger white head that dissipated slowly leaving some nice lacing.  Aroma: Lightly bready and wheaty with lots of sweet banana, banana bread and clove.  Taste: Sweet ripe banana with hints of bubblegum, clove and citrus lemon.  Mouthfeel: Medium bodied with mid to high carbonation.  Overall: A very balanced Hefeweizen that tastes great. But still can’t find this in Hong Kong and always have to carry it back in a suitcase.
Been craving wheat. Found this in local upscale pizza joint on tap. Brings me right back to DE.....

Beer poured into a Pilsner glass. Pours golden straw with a nice white head that disappears quickly. Smells of sweet grain, wheaty in nature. Tastes of sweet grain and wheat, but not overly strong. Beer is light bodied, heavily carbonated, extremely drinkable. Overall a very good beer.
Nice head that lasted Great color and smell Glove and banana taste Perfection of a Hefe, best in the world

Cloudy orange colour with a nice foamy white head. Predominant aroma is banana with a hint of rolling tobacco. Taste is also predominantly banana, with a touch of bubblegum-esque flavours maybe? A very refreshing beer overall, the kind you could sip copious amounts of on a sunny day.
Maybe the best weissbier. Very best example of how needs to be an Weissbier.

12 oz bottle poured into a weizen glass. Gave it the old yeast swirl as well.  L - bright golden yellow color with a yeasty haze. Standard Hefeweizen head, white and fluffy. Some lacing down the side.  S - banana notes, soft wheat, and yeast. Not too strong on the nose. Just soft German yeast and wheat.  T - soft bread up front, banana in the middle, with a nice clean finish. Very soft all around but crisp also. Banana is the dominant taste.  F - medium body. Kind of a soft, fluffy feel but easy to swish around.  O - One of the best hefeweizens out there. Top-notch on all accounts. A little pricey on the shelf so it is definitely a treat. Paulaner is a cheaper substitute, but the legacy of Weihenstephaner makes it worth it. Prøst

Poured a hazy straw color with a 2 finger head that dissipated quickly to a thin head, which remained. minimal lacing. Nose is of clove and banana. Carbonation is good with a medium body. Taste is excellent with the refreshing banana, clove lemon hints. Not as yeasty as Paulaner, my favorite.

I found a single from March but wanted to try it anyway. This beer did not taste old. The smell is yeasty and slightly spicy with a hint of lemon and banana. The taste is really nice. Crisp, smooth, and refreshing. Might be the smoothest, most easy drinking beer I've tasted.  UPDATE - after drinking several 6 packs of this beer I can say is is world class and surely one of the best beers out there. It's perfect. yb

This beer is simple and perfectly balanced but doesn't lack of character. It's soft and strong at the same time. Beautiful hazy straw with a cloud like head. It's just telling you "drink me! Drink me!". Well okay, just one moment to enjoy the aroma. Esters, esters, esters and a bit of phenols. Apple, clove, banana. The taste is of banana, pepper, clove, coriander and orange zest. The mouthfeel is perfectly carbonated. This beer keeps focus all along. Never become overly sweet (even if there is some) and always remains balance. The mouthfeel is amazing too, soft, gentle, velvety. As a beer connoisseur is funny to see how I can enjoy more and more at each try those classics beyond classics beer. No geeky thing, this is the real stuff.
Nice mild golden flavor, definitely feeling German. Maybe the best aftertaste I've ever had in a beer. A little foamy, but not enough to make me care. Goes down very smooth.
I am not a major German beer fan, but this is probably my favorite of all time. Very well balanced with a very complex flavor. I get hints of sweetness and the carbonation is perfect.
Awesome beer to have on any occasion. Can't get enough of it!
Its a good summer beer in my opinion.
Great beer. Slightly lacking in taste.
I Will be the first to admit that I knew nothing about beer although I do know what I like and I really like this beer

A beautiful beer. Served in a very tall .5L Weihenstephaner glass. Big fluffy head. Aroma and taste are like a perfect hefe. I always find it hard to say it tastes like clove or banana, just seems like a hefe flavor to me.

I am not a Hefe type of beer drinker but it's nearing Octoberfest, might as well drink fresh offering. Look: Nice white fluffy head and murky orange. Wish all my IPAs look like this. Smell: A lot of lemon. Taste: Very light and I do get lemons. Finishes very watery and with a slight tart. Feel: Heavy carbonation on first poor but dies down fast. I prefer to drink this fast since it's better with more carbonation. Overall: Not bad but not my style.
Great Hefeweizen. Makes for great Bananenweissen...I rated it a little lower because I think it's a little restrained and cautious compared to my favorite Hefe, the Live Oak.

This stuff is nothing short of phenomenal. Although a blind taste-test revealed that I like it just slightly less than Paulaner Hefe-Weizen, which is comparable in taste, these two are quite close and outstanding in caliber. It's incredible how well the pleasant flavor sticks around for awhile after drinking. The smoothness in drinking is impeccable. I can't recommend highly enough.
I could drink this everyday...except I'd probably go broke.

My favorite hefeweizen. Pours out to a golden yellow haze. Really nice dense half finger head. Fantastic banana bready aroma. A really smooth and full flavor of banana cloves lemon zest. A great hefe that I would recommend to anyone.
Not my preferred style of beer but i liked it very much. taste starts with a spice/banana taste then mellows out into a slight fruit floral flavor. good stuff.

Hazy yellow-golden body, billowing white head that renews itself every time I agitate my glass and leaves a ring of lace, plenty of carbonation. Aromas of realistic ripe bananas, mild clove. Taste has plenty of banana, a bit of wheat and yeast, clove which can hit a spicy peak, touch of bubblegum. Mostly dry. The burps produced taste just like banana bread. Body is rich and full, which is rare to pull off well in this category. This is, in my opinion, the pinnacle of the style. The flavor is realistic, full, precise, well balanced, and, most importantly, delicious. The body has a creamy quality that in no way diminishes how refreshing this beer is. Love it through and through.

A great hefeweizen. The color, smell, feel, everything was off the charts. Had the perfect amount of banana clove taste with a tiny bit of a sweet pineapple juice tang and soft corn bread. $3.99 a bottle to me is a pretty good deal.

This is a beautiful hefeweizen: a giant lingering creamy white head adorns the glass with thick rafts of lacing from its perch atop a pale gold, extra-sparkling body that straddles the line between hazy and cloudy. On the nose, it is a perfect blend of banana/clove spice and yeast, layered in excellent proportion to the big wheaty malt notes that underpin the aroma, with a bit of help from some slight alcohol undertones. The palate follows the nose, with the addition of a slight citrus tang and just a bit of malty sweetness around the edges. The finish is quick: equal parts malt and yeast, followed by a subtle hint of spice that lingers to the next sip. The mouthfeel matches the light body, and the texture is smooth, moderately creamy and very prickly from the extra-fizzy carbonation. This is an exemplary representation of the style, and is both delicious and eminently drinkable. (11.2 oz bottle, 162 days after pkg.)

Bought a 500ml bottle in my local supermarket for 0.90 € + 0.08 € deposit. Poured it into a Weizenglass. Amazing orange color with an almost everlasting, thick white head with lots of carbonation going on. A nice, fruity banana flavor comes into my nose. I also smelled some bread and citrus flavors. Very easy to drink and totally refreshing. Its not the best beer in the world but definitely one the best wheat beer around!

Extremely impressive, dense and thick three finger head which lasts quite some time. Fruity taste and very clear hefeweizen which is quite unusual. Although fruity it comes as strong and imo a true man's beer! Anyway, one of the best beers i ever tried. Period. Highly recommended!

This is what a hefeweizen should taste like. I think this might have been my first hefe way back. I have been trying a lot of American hefes recently and started thinking I have just grown out of the style. I picked this up the other day and was blown away again. This is an amazing brew.

Pours orange in color with a slight haze to it. Very nice white soapy-looking head.  Aroma is bready with notes of bananas and lemon zest.  A mild, sweet fruitiness begins the taste. I notice lemon or possibly other citrus notes, a touch of cloves. Finishes somewhat dry, with faint bready flavors scattered here and there.  Mouthfeel and carbonation are both extremely refreshing. High quality stuff.

Outstanding Hefe, easily the best I've had. With the hot and humid weather here, definitely one I could and will have again. Taste was breads, citrusy, and light malt. Wouldn't ruin this with any fruit.

Poured from a 500 ML bottle into a pint glass. Aroma- A fantastic aroma of cloves and bananas. Appearance- The beer pours a murky yellow/orange color with a thick white head. Taste- Outstanding flavor of cloves, fruit and wheat. Great balance Overall- A world class beer, even if you aren't a hefeweizen fan you should give it a try to see what a masterpiece of this variety tastes like.

For some reason, I've generally avoided hefeweizens. Felt like trying something different, so I bought a couple of bottles of this. Look is an awesome hazy, golden-orangish color. Body is more hearty than you might expect for a <6% beer. Head and lacing are near perfect. Taste was great--I drank this quickly. As I said, I'm not too big a hefe fan, but I am indeed now a fan of this.

Poured into a weizenglass.  A: Hazy/cloudy golden with a 1-finger foamy head  S: Banana, light malts, citrus and flowery  T: Definitely banana, somewhat wheaty, bubblegum and a hint of clove at the end  M: Medium body, smooth with medium carbonation  O: Awesome beer! Seriously, one of the best hefes that I've ever had! Love the banana-clove balance!

My favorite beer of all time. A must try for all beer lovers. Taste wonderful straight from the 6pack bottles or poured into your massive haufbrauhaus glass that has been sitting in your deep freezer at -10 defrees. One of the best things about this beer is how good it taste even when not freezing cold. Unlike alot of cheap skunky american beers, this beer remains delicious even after it loses its just from the fridge temp. I usually grab 2 cold 6packs from whole foods. Or if i don't feel like driving 30 minutes i'll stop into greens beverage to grab a couple room temp 6packs. Lovely beer for all occasions from grilling out to relaxing and watching a baseball game on tv! get some and enjoy!

Poured a cloudy light orange with copious off white head and ample lacing. Smells of esters, bubblegum, citrus, light notes of malt. Sweet malts forward with a pleasant citrus zing, banana, cloves around mid-note with a pleasant clean finish – minimal hops or astringency. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with fair amount of carbonation – not syrupy and has a rather clean finish. Overall , the ideal beer on a hot summer’s day – or between runs on a ski slope in Germany. A classic hefe that I go to again and again. Solid. I have yet to find an equivalent American version. . . If you enjoy this beer – check out their Vitus weizenbock – its even better (I like to think of it as an Imperial Hefe)

Found it here in Serbia, bottle 0,5 l  A - Unclear, light honey like color, big white head. No bubbles. S - Coriander, fresh herbs, bread aroma. T/ M - Carbonated, refreshing. Aroma of orange with coriander in the back. Low bitterness. Some sweetness.  O - Good Hefe.

A- This pours an opaque golden/yellow color that is beautiful to look at. The head starts out 3 fingers thick and eventually settles into a meringue like puffy cloud that is still around 1 finger over the Ale....color is super white. The carbonation is much too hard to tell in looks and I can say that the lacing is very modest at best. Still....a very nice looking brew overall!  S- Bananas and yeasty bread is first and foremost on the nostrils, with backing spices of cloves and a peppery note blended in there as well. There are also notes of Lemon and orange citrus zest and sweet caramel malts. The finish has just a hint of hop bitterness and is rather clean and refreshing smelling!  T- Refreshing citrus flavors take over the palate, as opposed to the aromas. Background flavors of baking spice is noted as well.....cloves, nutmeg and a muted peppery warmth balance out the sweet caramel/toffee malts. The finish is of unmalted grains and is very clean and refreshing. The peppery flavors noted linger on the palate with just a hint of heat.  M/O- Solid medium bodied beer with an immaculate carbonation that just blends so well for this style....it's assertive and the way it explodes on the palate really allows the flavors to burst with great intensity! The drinkability factor is perfect and this deserves to be in the top tier of German Hefeweizens.....I could enjoy this all night long without getting tired of it! I will most definitely get this one again!
The pinnacle of beer.
500ml Bottle.  Appearance - Murky golden hue.  Smell - Bready citrus.  Taste - Banana, cloves, citrus and bread.  Mouthfeel - Medium attenuation. Crisp.  Overall - Very good Hefe.  Grade (B+)
I love Hefeweizen and this is by far the best that I have had.

Look - Cloudy pale gold look with a few specks of yeast floating around. Smell - Yeasty, bready and a slight citrus hint. Some banana too. Taste - Spicy notes with banana and bready yeast. Finish with a spice taste that reminds me of clove but with the perception of heat from the carbonation. Feel - Carbonated and close to a medium feel. Not light but not medium either. Overall - A great beer that is easily drinkable.

Although this is a hefe, which ultimately translates to: 'with yeast', the appearance is not nearly as cloudy as say a Franziskaner Hefe or any hefeweizen. Likewise, the notes of banana and clove are very subtle comparatively. Great head, in line with it's style, and an exceptional body make this an EXTREMELY DRINKABLE hefe for even those of the fainter heart which usually yield to the banana/clove characteristics. You really can depend on anything from 'the world's oldest operating brewery, to produce the most drinkable and enjoyable of alcoholic beverages true to their style!

500mL bottle, I've had this one many times, I'm surprised I never reviewed it A - huge off-white head holds good retention atop a very hazed golden body S - banana, clove, wheat, bready yeast, faint lemon zest T - classic German Hefeweizen flavors, great balance between the above mentioned aromas M - light-to-medium body, higher carbonation, fairly clean finish O - a favorite in the style category for me. I've always loved this one.

Had this on tap at Republic a few weeks ago and wondered what was wrong -- a little too much banana and the mouthful was off -- but yesterday, had it from a 500 ml bottle into a weizen glass, and this was the near-perfection that I remember from past trips to Germany. Huge beautiful head, good but a little faint on the nose, perfect balance between yeast, spices and fruit...absolutely brilliant.

Served cool from 500ml bottle into Schneider weissebier glass. Drink by date of 6th July 2015. Assuming a best-by period of 1 year, this was brewed 3 weeks ago, so pretty fresh.  L) Medium orangish-yellow colour. Cloudy, although not opaque. Looks quite fizzy. 1cm dense white head.  S) Light sweetish caramel with a bit of light cloves.  T) Taste follows the nose, flavour is light with a good side of caramel sweetness. Banana-clove flavour is there, but is light. Chewy marshmallow tones. Ends up with a more open citrus-edged finish.  F) Fizzy, light with the clovey taste giving some weight. No bitterness.  O) Well well well. Had this one straight after a Franziskaner, and this in my opinion is the more subtle but frankly less tasty pretender. Having said that it is a tasty refreshing drink and it would be dumb to say otherwise. Good, but in my opinion not in the top tier of weizens.

This is what a world class hef tastes like. Greater complexity than the also great Franziskaner. I wish I could get the Live Oak interpretation but sadly they don't distribute outside of Texas.  Banana, clove, you know the deal with a Hefeweizen. What sets this apart is the execution. Beautiful mouthfeel, great fruity chew to it. Carbonation is perfect, looks like a dream in the glass. Head is abundant and lasts a good long while. Improves as it warms up, which is true of almost no American versions of this style. People who swear off the hef because they've never had a proper Bavarian need to better educate their palates before calling it a day.

Poured from a 12oz bottle into a mug because unfortunately I don't have a weizen glass.  A: Pours a picture perfect cloudy golden color with a dense, creamy, 2 finger head of white foam. After a minute or 2 the foam settles to a crown that caps the beer perfectly. A decent amount of lacing is left clinging to the sides of the glass.  S: Aromas of clove and baked banana bread, with a good amount of spice. Some fruity yeast esters and biscuity malts also coming out. A hint of white pepper as the beer warms.  T: There is a refreshing flavor of clove and banana bread with a light spiciness. Biscuity malts and a faint amount of fruity yeast esters. This beer has a somewhat strong phenolic character.  M: Light bodied with high carbonation and a crisp, refreshing mouthfeel. Semi dry on the finish.  O: Overall I thought this was a good beer with interesting flavors of clove and banana. It was crisp and refreshing, and would be a nice thirst quencher on a hot summer day. This could be a pretty versatile beer to pair with a variety of different foods. I would surely drink this again.

Can't wait to review this classic. Here goes:  A: Only drawback concerning the beer. Hazy orange-yellow. Head and lacing, like the appearance, aren't very adequate either. Good effervescence, though.  S: Very complex. Lots of wheat and yeast impart scents of banana, clove, coriander, and white pepper. Almost like a Belgian tripel.  T: Follows the nose. The beer is suffused with banana and coriander. Very sweet and spicy. Love the yeast profile.  F: Alright. Can't complain.  O: A very well-made beer.

Rousing. Initially arrested at the honey brown look. Lemonly , sweet yeast jumps out of the glass ans settles nicely on the palette. My favorite wheat beer. I'm already picturing my visit to this Bavarian bistro.
Passable.

This is the beer than any weissbier should look up to. Drinks as delicious as it smells. Perfect balance of flavors, with the typical banana flavor expected from a hefe. Absolutely a world class beverage.
Bottle code 8125 so bottled March 8, 2015.  Very cloudy beer, classic German yeast with light banana notes. Went perfectly with my fire roasted sausages.

Serving Type: 500 mL Bottle  A- Pours a Hazy, Pale yellow that is topped by a lumpy, white head. The head has incredible retention and leaves behind lots of lacing.  S- Banana, crisp apple, light orange, clove/coriander, and a light, grassy hop to finish.  T- The taste is more or less the same. Classic Hefe characteristics but done so incredibly well that it seems like a new experience.  M- Thick and wicked smooth. Moderate-Low Carbonaton.  O- I believe that Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier is easily the best Traditional Hefe I've ever had. There are no experimental flavours and no additional BS. Just a solid, classic Hefe look, aroma, taste, and body that is an extreme pleasure to experience.
The quintessential wheat beer. Pours a hazy golden color with rich head. Banana and clove aromas are prominently featured. A definite yeasty characteristic on the palate.

A: Cloudy, yellow, gold, with a ton of head that lingers  S: Banana and clove. Subtle though.  T: Very much like drinking a banana. Delicious. The real deal.  F: A little chewy with moderate carbonation.  Not a big fan of the style, but when drinking the real thing, everything changes. This is top notch.

Let me start by saying that this is not my choice of beer styles. I was recently on vacation, looked at the rating and decided to give it a try. Some of my rating is based on the comment made by my wife when she said, "That's REALLY good!!!  Brown/gold, a nice foam on top.  Smelled a little like banana, maybe some orange and other spices.  Tastes about the same with some flavors I couldn't identify.  Feel is velvety and thick.  Overall, I liked thought this was probably the best hefe I have ever had.
Good beer, however, I must confess that was below my expectations. Smell and taste of lemon and sweet orange. Lacks character and persistence in the mouth is not exceptional.
I've always loved this beer.

This beer pours a hazy golden color. Excellent head retention. Nose has a classic punch of banana, with maybe a bit of orange peel as well. Taste is clean, emphasizing the bready aspects of the beer more than the fruity. Refreshing a classic.
Remind me deep down to wheat like rip banana land

pours brownish gold, totally opaque with a thick three inches of foam. Looks good!  fruits, yeast, and bananas on the nose. baking spices too, and come orange peel. Nose has got it all, good stuff!  flavour is overripe peaches and orange with banana all over. Lots of spices like coriander in the mix. The taste of the yeast is strong and bready, really nice and thick. At the end there is a punch of fruit, like applejuice almost. finish is whole grains.  mouthfeel is velvety and thick, like a good hefe should be.  Overall, great hefe with all the notes hit in a great balance. Its particularly heavy on the fruit flavours but still stays balanced and full. I prefer the strong yeast flavours and big banana - Ayinger is still my #1 hefe - but this is a beauty piece of work all the way around!
Somewhat cloudy, light color and head, yet aromatic and flavorful, with a touch of spice. A must-try beer.

The typical notes of banana and bubblegum but lacked the crispness and flavor that I was expecting. While this was good it was not thoroughly impressed maybe because for me it lacked the crispness I was expecting. I would purchase this again but not as my first choice.
Bought a growler of this at Capitol market at the wine shop. This is my definition of a Hefe. Love this beer!

Poured from a pint bottle.  A: Pours a murky golden honey color with two fingers of frothy white head. Retention is insane, lacing is prominent and incredibly beautiful.  S: Sweet malts, banana, clove, honey, white pepper, wheat, apple, a slight citrus, and some grassy earthy hops.  T: Sweet malts, sweet bread, clove. banana, honey, citrus, herbal spices, and earthy hops. This is what a Hefeweizen should taste like.  M: Light bodied, mid-to high carbonation, incredibly smooth. Truly enjoyable to drink.  O: An absolute world-class phenomenal brew. The best Hefeweizen I have had so far. I highly recommend this beer to every BA. I have definitely earned my frequent drinker miles on this German classic.

Pours a beautiful, hazy, sunny, peach pulp color, with a dense, stable head.  Smells of ripe banana, red apple skin, together with grassy hops and white pepper. Banana shines through beautifully, while balanced by the hops and a coppery whiff, remaining the beers enjoyable balance.  Drinks incredibly smooth, carried by soft yeast, feels utmost silk on the palate, while providing enough carbonation to create an refreshing impression.  Begins with cakey malts, clove, honey and a fantastic yeast smoothness, establishing the beers world-class mouthfeel. While the spices are prominent, they do get tamed by earth, a glimpse of oak and the grassy, slightly herbal hops. Finishes with young banana, more clove and honey, while the hops provide a pleasant, refreshing herb presence.  The interplay between noteable carbonation and euro hops turns out great, as the beer don't need no bitter hop punch to balance the sweeter spices, but uses the metallic qualities from the carbonation to create a short, refreshing burn, taming the sweeter ingredients of the brew. As easy as this drinks, as convincing is the beers receipt, showcasing a truly well made Weissbier, which leaves a refreshing, perfectly balanced impression on the palate.
The perfect beer! Refreshing, no heavy clove/ bubblegum flavour. Not to use a clichè here, but it's perfectly balanced.

500 ml bottle purchased from Whole Foods and poured into a stemmed Spiegelau Pilsner glass. Really nice beer but thought it a little thin with somewhat less flavor than I expected. Would definitely drink it again but would rather have an Allagash White or St. Bernardus Witbier.
Best hefeweisen in the world!

This beer is the perfect Bavarian beer. Just all of the classic flavors here and really this is the beer that wheat beers are based off of. Sweet clove, banana flavors. Rich wheat body. Really fantastic and worth a swill, even though it is everywhere you look

Poured from 330 ml bottle. Color is yeasty golden haze. Thick white head and robust carbonation. I smell malt and a pleasant banana note, and spices in the background. Medium to full bodied. Tastes fruity and refreshing, with a dry finish. Very filling. One of my favorites.
Based on the style. Most consistent heffe I've ever had.
Defines the weißbier genre. Best ever.
One of my top 2 favorite hefes the other is Franziskaner (under rated hefe)  This beer is the definition of a Hefeweizen!

Bread, toast, dough, banana, woody, roasty. Excellent Heffeweissbier! Best I’ve tasted so far. Very refreshing and smooth. You know you’re drinking a quality wheat as soon as you taste it! A must have, for me.

This is the top of the class for the style, and for good reason. Everything about this beer is perfection. As much as I enjoy it here in the states, having it fresh from the brewery on tap at the Cologne Christmas Market was a transcendental experience.

Maybe the perfect wheat beer. I usually shy away from this style as I don't often like whatever gives it the seasoning flavor, but this beer is beautiful to look at, smells great and tastes like everything you could want in a refreshing, sweet summery beer.

Great traditional hefe. Pours a nice golden color with abut a 3 figure white, rocky head. Leaves a nice lacing for the remainder of the drink. Full smell, colve, wheat, and some bannana. Wonderfully balanced taste, with the above mentioned smells coming out. Great levels of carbonation. Second best hefe I've had, and the first one was more of a craft style.

Pretty carbonated for a Hefeweizen. This gives it a very lively and promising appearance when poured in the appropriate Weizen glass. The taste is just awesome. Lots of flavors (esters?) and a very smooth feeling in the mouth. A beer that lives up to its name.

Hazy golden yellow, with a thin dense head. Slightly sour and critrusy, grassy, light bitterness, with a lightly sweet, malty and loaded of banana finish. Medium body and fizzy carbonation. Good and well balanced.
I thought I knew what good weissbier was until I had this. Hail to the King Baby!!!

If I’m going to drink a hefe (and it’s not Live Oak’s) then it might as well be this one. Get it on draught.  I guess I don’t have much more to add to this review right now. This sure ain’t poetry. Beer reviews can be like that sometimes.
I am ashamed to say this is the first time I have tried this beer and it is glorious. Amazing in every way. Prost!
Wow you could bounce a quarter off head. Light and delish . Great find H
All I can say is store dark and keep cool 46-52 degrees F.
The best beer overall.Smooth easy drinking.

Hazy golden straw color with a strikingly thick foamy white head. The foam gradually settled into a nice cap that lingered nicely. Bright aromas of clove, wheat, banana, and dough. The tasted followed suit - big banana flavor with clove, and dough. Not much bubble gum if any. Flavors were well-balanced with a mild closing bitterness. Full-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel.
Perfection of the style - a beer that is mandatory to experience.
Man, what a beer. This is one that presents something new with each sip. I definitely found on tap to be a much more pleasing experience, but I think the bottles I've had may have been a bit elderly.

I was a bit concerned at first because it smelled as if it might be a bit skunky, but fortunately that wasn't the case. Very light and relaxed flavor with an aftertaste that should lend itself to a cheesy dish. Very nice.

500 mL bottle poured into a hefeweizen glass. The aroma is a mellow, creamy banana and vanilla with a complimentary clove and some subtle undertones of peaches. The beer is a cloudy pale with a hint of gold to it, and is topped by a creamy and frothy white head that retains well and leaves a light lace. The taste is a mellow and mild medium sweet with medium low bitterness. A creamy texture and carbonation go down smooth and easy with a medium body containing notes of fresh baked bread, banana, orange, vanilla, and a light woody clove spice that finishes clean with a lightly bitter clove and citrus zip and crispness that mellows quickly and turns over to a light oranges and nila wafers combination which stick in the aftertaste with a touch of lemon, and a lactose hint. Quite delightful.
This beer is much easier to drink than spell.
What you might expect from the world's oldest brewery. It's top notch.

We love this beer and just bought another case of it. Smooth taste, fun to drink it through the foam head, light wheat taste with hints of citrus. Low alcohol content makes it a good addition to lunch or dinner meal. Not too filling and leaves a great after taste.  This is our favorite beer. Started drinking in Munich and have not stopped.

Nectar of the Gods. This gets bought in 6-packs. Peppery and not overly bubbly, this really goes down a treat with pork roast. These guys have been brewing for about 6 million years and it shows. World Class.

Pours a murky, golden-yellow color with a white foamy head. Glows a beautiful, radiant golden color when light shines through. Great retention. Little to no lacing.  Aroma contains a strong scent of lemon rind, grassiness, and yeast. Reminiscent of fresh grass clippings on a hot summer day.  Taste is refreshing. Subtle lemon notes and orange zest. A perfect amount of yeast--doesn't dominate but it very present. Hint of bubblegum. Some nice sweet, tartness on the finish.  Mouthfeel is light bodied. Extremely crisp and refreshing. Quite possibly the most drinkable beer I've ever had. I could've chugged this pint in no time.  Overall, Hefes are typically towards the bottom of my favorites list, but this one did quite a bit to change that. Definitely the best Hefe I've ever had, and one of the better beers I've ever had, period. Great beer, one that even a newbie to craft beer could appreciate, or even a craft veteran. Great for anyone, on any occasion.
A good hefe weizen beer.
good standard for hefeweizen style.

This is more of what I'm used to in regard to a Hefeweizen (as opposed to Schlafly's Hefeweizen). I think I'm still a little more partial to the "American Wheat" style that most people seem to consider Schlafly's Hefeweizen to be, but this is still probably one of the best of the style.
A solid beer...pretty complex amount of flavors. Fairly earthy, some spice, banana. Takes a little adjusting if you aren't used to the style. Worth the try!

Nice frothy head, wonderful taste. This is the kind of Beer that you have to force your self NOT to drain the entire glass upon the first taste. This is my first time trying Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier, and I am in Love. I actually said to my wife, "This is the best beer that I have ever put in my mouth!" I would recommend it to anyone who wants to taste a truly great Beer.
On tap at Jacob Wirth
Light and balanced with a slight, pleasant fruity aftertaste
This is my favorite Hefe and the beer that got me into this!

Pours cloudy yellow-orange with a billowing white head.  The nose is an inviting blend of banana, bubblegum, clove, and bread.  The taste follows, with hints of vanilla.  The mouthfeel is great as well. Creamy and smooth.  This is not only delicious but also the beer that started my craft obsession. My first love in the beer world. You can't do much better than fresh Weihen Hefe on tap.

Everything about this beer (bier?) is phenomenal, particularly the taste, which is worth the most. I've been missing out for years, but I'll know to buy Hefe Weissbier from here on out. I had to create an account just to rate this beer. It pours like any champion beer and goes down easily with a great taste. Their experience really proves itself once you taste it.
Best beer in its style IMO

Lovely, a real grower. The first pour I thought yes you may have already lived up to your crazy rating. I bought this for a reasonable price in Forestside Sainsburys N. Ireland and pleaded please live up to your high reputation.  What a lovely body then a nice fresh floral smell that actually smells good, not how Outcast would say roses smell like. The smell for me is not heavily pronounced, light actually for a hefe.  I had my first, enjoyed it like any hefe lover only could but didn't find anything special. I had a very nice dunkel, then another of these then an Erdinger Urwiesse which was nice then another of these and at that moment realised how good this this is. It could literally follow ANY beer any still be great. The last few sips of this beer is where it really comes into its own. Chewy, tasty, clove like and very little banana. I prefer a little more of a wheat feel and taste and probably a little more carbonation.

This is one awesome beer. Nothing better in the warm weather. This is a standard Heffe in style, but it wins on every level. The aroma is strong with the cloves sneaking in first, followed by the banana. The taste lingers heartily and stays pretty constant. A must try considering its widespread availability.

From XXXII. One of the best in its style, although like all wheat beers its too much weak for my taste  25 Nov 2017. From estucerveza. In Bavaria Hefe glass. At lunch, after futsal match. With macaronni bechamel + croquettes + rice soup with eggs leftovers. Typical notes of the style very well executed, with a specially thick body and vivid carbonation (a bit less could be better)
overall a pretty good beer!
Hazy yellow, smells of wheat. Flavor us banana and clove. Delicious.
The very best hefeweizen I've ever had to date

A - hazy straw coloured in the glass with a dense foam which left good lacing. S - notes of banana and a little clove. Scent has some vapour edge which seemed to go up the nose but not unpleasant. T - the clove flavour of the yeast really dominates for me but surprisingly I didn't mind it. I prefer it to the overly banana flavours of some Hefeweizen. M. - nice carbonation with the light body making it very refreshing. O - I'm not the biggest fan of Hefeweizen beers but quite liked this. The clove flavour might be a bit much after a couple but it was very refreshing on a hot day. If I was having a Hefeweizen I would be happy to have this.

This is just the best looking beer ever. I am floored by the fact that this is a standard brew in Germany... what a treat. This brew, and style, shows that not everything has to be a huge hop bomb or puckering stout. Just clean, fresh deliciousness!
It is good but not the best as some.
Good color and classic smell.

Poured from a large bottle into a German beer stein, to be authentic.  A lovely straw yellow hue, with a crazy thick head that sticks around for an extended period of time. Lots of little bubbles rising throughout. Smells yeasty and of biscuit. Tastes refreshing, with tons of banana and biscuity flavor, little notes of spice as well. A tremendous, refreshing hefe; one of the pillars of the style, clearly.
Wow wow wow it's just right.. Let's compare it to a woman... She goes down smooth and she's the perfect mix of a few of your favorites... Love it!

Simply the best Hefe I've ever had. The standard by which all others are judged. Enjoyed many times over the years in various glasses. Always a pleasant pour with a frothy head. Rich mouth feel with medium to light carbonation. Notes of banana and spice.
Bottle of weihenstephaner Hefe weizen drank

It's a great beer. It poured beautifully, had notes of ripen bananas and fruity esters. Very easy to drink and light-bodied. It seems to be missing that subtle peppery bite that I look for in a hefeweizen. It doesn't compare to New Glarus Dancing Man - which has set the bar really high. It might be that this beer is not fresh. Could not find the bottle date and bought this off a shelf at room temp. I have no doubt that drinking this straight from the source or from a fresh bottle would leave this beer tasting much better than now. I will take the next opportunity to try this beer again when I find it refrigerated.

Not sure I understand the fascination with this beer. I'm not a hop snob and appreciate Czech and German pilsners and lagers and enjoy Hefe Weisbiers as well. Who knows ? Maybe the main streamers who put a lemon wedge in this stuff are right. Think it would help.

-very sweet malt flavours like honey or caramel -heavy on clove -nice floral and citrus notes -banana is more subdued compared to other Hefeweizen -probably the best carbonated beer ive had,the head stayed for a good 30mins it seemed -very sweet,creamy finish  Really great one,though most itt know that already. though i have to say that i slightly prefer banana-heavy weizens above this like Franziskaner,Maisels Weisse or Schneider weisse

I can't deny how good this is. They hit it right. Perfect amount of carbonation and perfect amount of banana flavors. The only thing I can say is that the smell gets a 4 but who cares about that. Everything else is a 5. I still enjoy many other hefeweizens but this one truly is that extra bit better than all the others I have had. Fantastic beer.
Great beer! I'd drink this any day.
love wheat beer. This is a great one
Rich and spicy clove notes blend with balanced fruity esters. Perfect body. Incredibly drinkable and refreshing. Simply the definition of the style.

Purchased 500 ml bottle from the health food store for about $3 and poured into a tall beer glass. A very hazy rich golden-yellow color with a fluffy pure white head that slowly fades leaving slight lacing. Aroma is of bread, yeast and slight citrus. Taste is really nice with some citrus and bread followed by a muted cinnamon/nutmeg-like spiciness that really makes the beer. Towards the bottom of the pint, the beer started to have a slight metallic after-taste, maybe due to the trip across the Atlantic. Goes down really easy, but is not super thin - enough body to keep you from pounding it, but enough carbonation to keep it refreshing. Overall, a fantastic wheat beer and a great deal for the price.

I love hefeweizens, but I'm not sure I understand the super high rating on this one. I can't really tell this difference between Weihenstephaner, Hacker-Pschorr, Paulaner, or Tucher. They all seem equally delicious. While I love the style, this particular brew does not stand out from the crowd.

Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier - Bayerische Staatsbrauerei Weihenstephan. Poured from a bomber into a weizen glass, this brew's got a four finger thick, frothy on the outside but finely foamed on the inside head. I've never seen one quite like this. Along with the golden hazed body.  I smell earthy grains and a touch of fruit zest. This oughtta be good...   This brew's taste is a very lively and crisp malt characteristic combined with a slightly dry fruit in there, kind of mid-swig. A very great balance of those tastes and a high drinkability.  Mouthfeel here is very clean and crisp. I can't wait to enjoy one of these on a hot day after a few hours of working outside.  Overall, a 4.75 for Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier - Bayerische Staatsbrauerei Weihenstephan. Not quite perfect for a 5, but this is up there fellow BA's and also those new to this who'd like something lighter on the palate yet still bursting with great flavor.
While I am not a fan of wheat beer to begin with, I must say that I still had better of this style. At least it is drinkable and refreshing on a summer day.
Its a different hefeweissen beer
Very bready. Good head. Fantastic flavor.

Appearance: Very hazy straw color with a huge fluffy head that did not want to go down!  Smell: Very strong yeast smell. Some wheat aroma, but mostly yeast - spicy, citric, nutty.  Taste: Yeast are up front, providing that hard to pin down flavor - banana, citrus, spice, clove, soybean, peanut. Dry wheat malt flavor follows it up. The flavors are strong, but smooth and balanced.  Mouthfeel: The thickness and fine carbonation give this one a very creamy feel. No residual feel.  Overall: I can see why this brewery has been around for so long. All the components of this beer are bold, but well blended. I usually get bored of Hefe’s before finishing 12 onces; this one left me wanting another 16.

dense fluffy head, takes awhile to disappear, great earthy, yeasty aroma, taste follows smell, yeasty and earthy, orange on toast, several layers of flavor, medium body, full mouth feel, smooth finish, about perfect for the style.
Lots of earthy hay on the nose, grainy malt flavor that is light and crisp. A standard of thr style.
A solid German Hefeweizen great for a hot summer day. Has to be one of the better beers I have tasted.

Pours a cloudy light amber. World Class head volume, lacing and retention.  Classic wheat nose of light clove and banana, a touch of lemon, yeast and biscuit. As it warms, a subtle spicy character emerges.  Medium bodied with a very smooth texture that approaches creamy. Well carbonated with a rich effervescence from the middle on.  This beer is the standard for Hefe Weissbiers and is world class. The flavor profile is intense, complex and well balanced. It begins with a mild tartness that separates into lemon and banana. As these fade in the middle, clove comes forward over a biscuit background with a hint of spice and dryness. The finish is crisp, with a mild biscuit fading and leaving clove.
Very good hefe , I really enjoyed, lots of bananas, IMO I actually prefer the paulaner hefe over this one at the moment but it is very good.
Tried this on tap! Was VERY good and actually very cheap. I had forgotten my growler or this would have been the beer I bought!!!!!!

- great head and it holds the head - the best smelling hefenweizen i have ever light pleasant mellow yeast -smooth and balanced, light hop complements the wheat flavor and yeast - crisp refreshing but without loosing flavor, light but not overly carbonated - beer lived up to its name for me great summer beer, and german beer example
a great day bier from the original bier maker
Simply the best in class.
Subpar compared to the excellent Dunkel.
On tap. Perfect to style. Just delish.
Worth trying more than once!

King of the hefeweizen for a reason. If you can find one fresh, this thing explodes not only with banana and spice but also a surprising, almost tropical, fruit note. Fluffy, buoyant feel. This thing is a treasure.
I may not be rating this as high as most people on here, but that definitely does not mean I dislike this. Good beer all around.
Pours hazy, light colour with a large white head. Spicy banana smell. Mildly sweet spicy taste with mild carbonation. Definite repeat.

Half liter bottle poured into weiss glass. Appearance is cloudy orange, with a towering three finger head that has some stickiness. Aroma is textbook, banana and clove spiciness plus wheat and malted sweetness. Flavor is malty and yeasty with sweetness and spice. Lemon, banana bread, clove, alcohol, and just a fuzz of hop bitterness. Medium bodied, creamy texture, soft but abundant carbonation, drying finish. Perfect for the style and excellent overall.

A: hazy; light straw colored; 1 finger pillowy white head that receded slowly to a thick cap; thick rings of lace;  S: clove and banana, with bubblegum in the background;  T: light clove and a touch of pilsner malt up front; banana and bubblegum come in mid-palate; banana stays through the finish; bitterness is almost imperceptible;  M: light bodied; highly carbonation;  O: outstanding;

Cloudy pale golden color with a big white head. Smooth, malty, banana flavored beer. Aromas of must, funk, yeast. Light bodied, refreshing flavors. Mainly fruit with some bitter hoppiness towards the end.

Maybe I'm not sophisticated enough, or I'm just too accustomed to American beers, but I did not like this beer much (Don't hit me!)  Definitely could tell it was an ancient recipe. I loved the look of it - had a nice dark to light gradient, and feel was solid - nice medium body, but the taste and smell was not pleasing to me. Had a weird barley, bacterial taste.
Not my style of beer.
Exactly what I expect in a German style Hefeweizen.
Just a normal hefeweizen beer, I really don't get why people love it.
This is one of the best Hefe-Weiss beers I've had. High quality and smooth drinking with the absolute perfect balance of spice and malt. This beer would be outstanding had it been a little cooler.
Smooth with a nice fruity finish. I would def buy again. Top notch.
Wow. All the garbage that's labeled Hefeweizen in the US does not even come close. Will definitely seek this out again!
Pours a cloudy orange. Bubbly awesome head. Smells malty and sweet. Maybe banana? Just enough sweet and spice. Beautifully balanced beer. Never had such a pleasant experience with a Hefeweizen.
What can I say that isn't already known about this beer. This is the ultimate form (thanks Plato) of the Hefeweissbier. World class for sure.
Absolute quintessential heffeweisebeer; the creme de la creme of beers. Flavor, look, body, nose and finish are world class. You simply cannot deny the excellence within the bottle, try as you may.
Perfection in a beer. Recommend

A delight to find iin Nigeria. 500ml bottle poured into tulip glass; a nice 3-finger fluffy white head, very persistent, leaving lacing all the way to the bottom of the glass; cloudy ambercolor; Big aroma of wheat, cloves, malt, some light citrus and hint of banana; nice sweet malty taste with a little citrus bite; creamy smooth feel on the tongue makes me want another.

500 ml bottle, with no apparent bottled on date present. My first encounter with a bottle of Weihenstephaner.  Poured into a clear balloon snifter.  A - Pours a bit of a darker golden body than expected. Three big fluffy fingers of white head. Some spotty fluffy lacing. Standard appearance, but looks good for what it is.  S - The aroma is simple, yet befitting of the style. Lots of yeasty / clove spiciness.  T - The taste is classic of the style - creamy, yeasty, crisp, bready, floral, and spicy.  M - The feel is very crisp, clean, and easy-drinking. Light bodied with good carbonation.  Overall, hefeweizens have never been my favorite, but this is clearly a well-executed and refined example of the style. Looking forward to trying more from Weihenstephaner.  Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier -----4/5.

For me, on this night, the beer tasted somewhat metallic. I am new to this but wonder if I just got a bad one. Loved the kristallweiss that I had a couple of days ago but was not as impressed by this one. Will have to try it again. Wish I could find some sort of date on the bottle.
Billowing white head, fantastic retention.  Smell and taste of lager flavours, bready wheat, slight citrus/berry with a tinge of earthiness. Smooth, creamy, yeasty, and crisp. This has it all.
My absolute favourite Hefe-Weiss Bier! (Along with their dunkel!)
Pretty good beer to tacos
Will buy again soon, very soon
Deliciously made and well crafted beer with a subtle hint of banana flavor.

This is the first German beer I have tried and is by far my favorite beer, now I underatand why they say Germany makes the best beer. I recently turned 21 and started trying different types of beer to find what I like, and well this is a winner.

Poured cloudy with a orange hue. Low head and retention...probably not a well-cleaned glass. EDIT - good retention on later pours). I get plenty of the banana and clove esters I was expecting, some sweetness, and a little bread. Definitely some canned corn, and other yeast notes. So good. Taste is just as good. Full-flavored hefe with better mouthfeel than most. Nice finish as well. Pretty much a must-dring hefe, and the decision is even easier considering how reasonably priced this usually is.

This is flat out one of my favorite beers. I am a huge fan of the style, so I am a little biased. When it comes to Hefeweizen I feel this is one that others should be compared to. Great body, aroma, and flavor. Top of the class!
This tastes like a German Biergraden. It's top notch and arguably the best of its style. Plus, relatively easy to find at my local specialty grocer.

Appearance : yeast galore! Tall head covers 90% of the pint glass and only 6 oz have been poured. So yeah great head, slightly hazy orange glow with beautiful sediment floating around.  Aroma : yeast, fresh baked bread, spicy citrus and clean hop leaf. Very crisp and pleasant smell.  Flavor : wheat, banana, orange, fruit salad, with lots of zip and warmth, just so perfect it's hard to describe really. It's so blissful.  Mouthfeel : creamy, dense, crisp, zippy.  Overall : One of my top 5 beers now. Seriously amazing.

Nice hazy appearance. Not sure how to describe the smell on this one. Predominant banana flavor. Nice light body. Best hef in recent memory. I will definitely be revisiting this one on a hot summer day.
Best beer in the world. If I could only drink one brand the rest of my life, this is it.
best weiss beer ever... glad my girl liked it too
Pours beautifully. Murky orange hue with a thick head. Smells perfectly. Banana, malt, clove. Taste...perfect. Mouthfeel...same. Enough said?
Very cloudy Amber. Thick, rich foamy head. Banana & clove aroma. Slightly sweet. Wheaty, banana flavor. Carbonation tickles the tongue. Delicious!
A quality hefe lacks a bit of the yeast flavor. The banana comes through. I would drink it again.

Absolutely amazing Hefeweiss. Beautiful hazy shade of straw with hints of orange in a classic Weihenstephaner pint glass with a nice layer of creamy head on top. Taste is as good as it gets in my opinion. Creamy, sweet, but not too much, fortunately, and overall just amazing. Drank a few at Prater biergarten while on my trip to Berlin and just the great memories of Weihenstephaner together with some nice Bratwurst make me want to go back.
Very good beer my favorite by far at the moment
Perfect Weissbeer, couldn't been better
Nice clove flavor, not over the top. Excellent texture. Light citrus for a refreshing brew.
The origin of beer!!! Still going strong. One of the best beers I ve had.

This beer is as close to perfection as it gets! Pours a murky straw yellow with hints of orange sunset. Massive finger length head retains throughout, the lace creamy and sticky! Aroma has a pleasant fruity ester, with a prominent orange rind feel as well as yeasty tones. Wonderful taste, simple but flavorful in all of its elements, citric with hints of lemon and orange, wheat, and yeast and a slightly dry finish. Great feel; creamy, smooth, light body. A lively carbonation is ever present. This is so drinkable, I feel I could have like three of these in a row! Crisp and refreshing! Will have again and again and again!
My example of the perfect beer! An exceptional balance of Bavarian Hefe flavors and smoothness. This is where the bar is set for Bavarian-style Hefeweizen.

Poured from a Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier bottle into a weissbier glass:  Appearance: A cloudy yellowish, yeasty luminescent color topped by a three finger-width white head that leaves decent lacing on the glass.  Aroma: A light fruity fragrance with slight clove accents.  Taste: More carbonation than a Franziskaner, with a tangy, fruity aftertaste that does not disappoint.  Mouthfeel: Medium body, some carbonation on the tongue and creaminess.  Overall: This is a very good Hefeweizen, not quite as good as a Franziskaner, in my opinion, but definitely up there.
Amazing wheat beer! Probably the best wheat beer I have ever tried
The gold standard for Hefes....tough to beat this on a hot summer day.
One of the most balanced and rich hefeweizen. Must try.
Possibly my favorite beer. It goes down so easy. Love in a glass.
Very good beer. Flavourful, not too heavy, good mouthfeel. Overall excellent weissbier
There's a reason this is the highest rated Hefeweizen. It's amazingly balanced. This is my go to beer, especially in the summer.

An exceptional brew, & best ever Hefeweizen! Pours a cloudy pale gold, HUGE off white head. Smells of bananas & malt. Taste follows the nose with a twang of wheat & a slight spiciness of clove, but PERFECTLY balanced. Simply THE BEST hefeweizen on the planet.

Poured into a half-liter weissbier glass. Produced a nice 3-finger fluffy white head, very persistent, the head lasted a good five minutes and left some very nice lacing all the way to the bottom of the glass. The beer is a golden yellow color, thick and hazy, just as a good hefeweizen should look. The aroma of this beer is huge, with wheat, cloves, malt, some light citrus and just a hint of banana. The clove flavors really shine in the taste, along with some nice citrusy notes and banana, with a very nice sweet malty backbone. The mouthfeel is very nice, medium bodied, creamy smooth on the front of the tongue, with the high carbonation adding just the perfect finish on the back of the palate. This hefe is the standard against which all other hefe's should be measured. A world-class beer at such an outstanding price - I paid about a dollar each - outstanding beer at a super-low price- sign me up!

I honestly can't believe I passed this beer over based on price point for several years (4$ a pint bottle in Washington State). Glorious head that shadows a variable fruit flavored offering. I got green apple, green banana, pink grapefruit/lemon. Champagne bubbly finish. Must try.

A - Large amount of creamy white head. Dissipates fairly quickly. Very murky dirty orange color. Lots of carbonation.  S - Lots of wheat, some malt, hints of citrus.
